NAME: Curcumins (from turmeric), curcumin(i), turmeric yellow(ii)
DESCRIPTION: Curcumin is the main yellow-orange pigment of turmeric grass (Curcuma longa or saffron from India). It can be isolated by steam distillation, or extracted by chemical extraction solvents. It is used as a natural coloring agent in food products, and can also be produced artificially. Halal if it is pure milled powder of turmeric or granular. Mushbooh if used as a liquid, the solvents must be Halal. Haram if the hidden ingredient is an emulsifier based on pork fat in dry mix. Go carefully with this additive, some industries extract it from PIG FAT (pork fat), according to Dr. M. Amjad Khan: Try to avoid it, since it has PIG FAT (most likely).

NAME:
Riboflavin (Vitamin B2), formerly called lactoflavin
- riboflavin, synthetic (i)
- riboflavin 5'-phosphate sodium (ii)
- riboflavin from Bacillus subtilis (iii)
DESCRIPTION: Natural riboflavin is the vitamin B2 found in wheat bran, eggs, meat and milk, among other things. They are used as natural coloring agents in food products. These dyes are naturally produced in the liver, kidney, eggs, milk and vegetables. They can also be prepared industrially by the synthesis of certain yeasts. E101 gives food a yellow color, but its use is limited by its low solubility. This additives is Mushbooh, Go carefully with this additive, sometimes it can come from pig liver and kidney then it would be Haram. But sometimes it comes from vegetable places.

NAME: Tartrazine (FD&C Yellow 5)
DESCRIPTION: E102 gives a yellow color to food products and is very soluble in water. The coloration is derived from coal tar. It is used in desserts, custards, custards, cookies, bread, flour, breakfast cereals, sauces, mustards, mayonnaises, soups, smoothies, juices, soft drinks, soft drinks, liquors, alcoholic beverages, cheeses, canned seafood, fish products, canned vegetables, pickles, pasta, chips, snack, sweets and candies. Tartazine, if obtained from a natural source, is soluble in water and is Halal. If it is obtained from a synthetic dye, then it is Halal only if it is mixed with vegetable oil.

NAME: Alkannin[12]
DESCRIPTION: It is strong yellow. It is obtained derived from petroleum. Belongs to the group of i azo dyes i. It is used in pastry and ice cream production. In small doses can cause problems of hyperactivity in children by the consumption of the dye. This additive is Halal, since it comes synthetic or of vegetable origin.

NAME: Quinoline Yellow WS
DESCRIPTION: It is an artificial petrochemical compound, yellow or green. E104 is highly soluble in water. It is also used in cosmetics such as hair products, lipsticks and perfumes, as well as in a wide variety of foods. It is potentially carcinogenic, including its production residues and is also neurotoxic. It is better to avoid this additive since it is very toxic to health. There are reports that there is a known risk of hyperactivity in children.

NAME: Fast Yellow AB
DESCRIPTION: It is a chemical dye and Halal if used as dry powder. Liquid form is Halal only if Halal solvent was used. It is forbidden in USA & Europe.

NAME: Riboflavin-5-Sodium Phosphate
DESCRIPTION: From riboflavin and chlorophosphoric acid. Might be from pork.

NAME: Yellow 2G
DESCRIPTION: Amarillo 2G is a colorant (synthetic colorant) for foods indicated by the number E107 with the CI18965 color index. It has the appearance of a yellow powder and is soluble in water. It is a synthetic yellow azo dye. Belongs to the group of i azo dyes i Halal if used as a 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as a liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal.

NAME: Sunset Yellow FCF (Orange Yellow S, FD&C Yellow 6)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products. E110 is a yellow synthetic coal tar food dye that is highly soluble in water. It is a synthetic azo dye and is generally used in fermented foods that require heat treatment. Some think that E110 worsens asthma and, when taken in combination with benzoates, it induces hyperactivity in some children. People with intolerance to salicylates may also find that they are intolerant to E110, because the coloration is an azo dye. Some reports also mention nausea, severe weight loss and vomiting as side effects of E110. Halal if used as a 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as a liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal.

NAME: Orange GGN
DESCRIPTION: Orange GGN, also known as alpha-naphtha, is an azo dye. In Europe, it was named with the number E111, but its use in food since January 1, 1978 is prohibited. Examples of foods that may include E111: ul li Candies li li Ice creams li li Patisserie li ul It is obtained by synthesis of the feces of some types of rats and mice in their first months of life (for this reason we consider it Haram).

NAME: Cochineal, Carminic acid, Carmine (Natural Red 4)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a coloring agent in food products and beverages, as well as in cosmetics. It is bright red to dark carmine. It is obtained by crushing insects of the cochineal family (i Dactylopius Coccus i) (Found in Central America) and parasites of some species of cactus. After the acid obtained it is necessary to combine it with aluminum, ammonia, or calcium to extract the shades of colors. It takes 100,000 females to make 1 kilo of product. E120 gives a red color to the products. This coloration is expensive and highly soluble in water. This additive is Haram, because it comes from an insect.

NAME: Citrus Red
DESCRIPTION: It is orange to red. It is obtained by synthesis of the skin of some citrus fruits such as oranges or grapefruit. It is used in citrus fruits so that it seems that they are already ripe when they have had little time of exposure to the sun, and in pickled products to give reddish color. p In low doses produces bladder and gall bladder stones. In large doses decreases the number of red blood cells and hemoglobin, while increasing the size of the kidneys, liver, and spleen. In the long term it gives degenerative problems in the liver, and different kinds of tumors in mice. Prohibited in Europe since 1977. When coming from orange peel or grapefruit, then it is Halal

NAME: Carmoisine (azorubine)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products, as well as in cosmetics. E122 is a red synthetic coal tar food dye that is highly soluble in water. When it is powder type then it is 100% Halal. But in liquid form it is only Halal in the case that the solvents are Halal. Sometimes in fermented heated food products that may not be Halal.

NAME: Amaranth (FD&C Red 2)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products, as well as in photography. E123 gives the products a red purple coloration and is highly soluble in water, so it is useful as a dye in photography. E123 is often used in wines and liquors. E123 is associated with asthma and eczema, as well as with hyperactivity in children. There have also been some doubts about the possibility that E123 is carcinogenic. People with intolerance to salicylates may find that they are intolerant to E123, because the coloration is an azo dye. It is Halal if it is used as a powder coloring. The liquid dye is Halal only if only Halal solvents are used.

NAME: Ponceau 4R (Cochineal Red A, Brilliant Scarlet 4R)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products. E124 is a synthetic carbon tar and an azo dye that turns the food products bright red. It is highly soluble in water. Some believe that E124 worsens asthma, causes allergic reactions (especially in those allergic to aspirin) and possibly also acts as a carcinogen in animals. Keep in mind that this additive can be generated synthetically (in the case of Ponceau 4R) or naturally in the case (Cochineal Red A). The Cochineal Network A is an insect, that's why it's considered Haram. But if Ponceau 4R is synthetic, in this case it is Halal.

NAME: Ponceau SX, Scarlet GN
DESCRIPTION: E125 is a synthetic dye. It is deep red. It is obtained derived from petroleum. Belongs to the group of i azo dyes i. E125 is used as a disodium salt. In the United States, its use in foods is not allowed, it can only be used in medicines and cosmetics applied externally. An exception was added in 1965 to allow the coloration of maraschino cherries, which were then considered primarily decorative and inedible. This exception was repealed in 1976 due to growing evidence of their safety concerns. Its long-term use could be carcinogenic. p Prohibited in Europe since 1976 and in the United States since 1988 (except medicines and cosmetics for external use). p Halal if used as a 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as a liquid color, verify the Halal state of the solvent.

NAME: Ponceau 6R
DESCRIPTION: E126 is a synthetic dye. It is deep red. It is obtained derived from petroleum. Belongs to the group of i azo dyes i. Although prohibited in the European Union, it is still authorized in cosmetic ingredients, where it can be renamed as CI 16250. In small doses it is a possible cause of hyperactivity in children. Halal if used as a 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as a liquid color, verify the Halal state of the solvent.

NAME: Erythrosine (FD&C Red 3)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products, as well as in photography. E127 is cherry red in color to pink, violet or purple. It is derived from fluorescein by extraction with iodine and iodic acid in alcohol. E127 is a pink red colorant that contains iodine and is highly soluble in water. It can also be used in dentistry, as a plate revealing agent, and in photography, as a printing ink. In the case that the product is dry, it is Halal. But it is Haram if the extraction process is used alcohol (Case that is liquid product). For this reason we consider it Mushbooh.

NAME: Red 2G
DESCRIPTION: E128 gives a red coloration to food products. It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products. It is highly soluble in water and tends to be used in meat and confectionery products. In low doses can cause hyperactivity in children. Because it is a Azo dye may cause intolerance in allergic people to salicylic acid. In large doses it is a histamine releaser and can increase the symptoms of asthma, produce eczema, hives and insomnia. Within the intestine it can be converted into the toxic compound Aniline and cause serious damage. In the long term it could be carcinogenic. Mushbooh is considered for now because it is unknown how it is manufactured. It is advisable not to consume it.

NAME: Allura Red AC (FD&C Red 40)
DESCRIPTION: It is obtained derived from petroleum. It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products, as well as in medicine and cosmetics. E129 is an azo dye that gives the products a dark orange red coloration. It was originally introduced to act as an alternative to amaranth (E123). This coloration has been related to bladder cancer in mice, after laboratory tests. This additive is Halal.

NAME: Indanthrene blue RS
DESCRIPTION: It is a dark blue additive. It is obtained by the oxidation of Anthracene, an aromatic hydrocarbon. When derived from a hydrocarbon it is potentially carcinogenic. It produces allergies and hives in a few minutes. Mushbooh is considered for now because it is unknown how it is manufactured. It is advisable not to consume it.

NAME: Patent Blue V
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products. E131 is highly soluble in water and gives it a blue color. Some allergic reactions have been reported along with the intake of E131. Other side effects have included low blood pressure, nausea and skin irritation. Because it is an azo dye can cause intolerance in people allergic to salicylic acid. In the long term it could be carcinogenic.

NAME: Indigo carmine (indigotine, FD&C Blue 2)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products. E132 is highly soluble in water and gives it a blue color. It is most commonly used as an additive for capsules and tablets. It is a coal tar derivative and can also be used as a biological dye. E132 occurs naturally in the indigofera tinctoria shrub, but is always synthesized when used commercially. It has been found in some studies that E132 causes nausea, vomiting, high blood pressure (hypertension), difficulty breathing and skin irritation. It is a dye that is used to be extracted from plants but is now produced synthetically and is Halal if it is produced synthetically from Halal sources. Liquid for solvent required, liquid for Halal only if Halal solvent is used.

NAME: Brilliant Blue FCF (FD&C Blue 1)
DESCRIPTION: t is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products, but mainly in cosmetics. It is obtained derived from petroleum. E133 is highly soluble in water and gives a blue color to food products. E133 can be used together with tartrazine (E102) to give various shades of green. The coloration can also be used in inks and as fabric dye. It is known that E133 causes an allergic reaction (although this is thought to be rare)

NAME: Chlorophylls and Chlorophyllins: (i) Chlorophylls (ii) Chlorophyllins
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic dye in food products and beverages. It is divided into 2 classes: ul li E140 (i): chlorophylls li li E140 (ii): chlorophyllins li ul E140 (i) and E140 (ii) give a dark green color and occur naturally (for photosynthesis) on all floors. E140 (i) and E140 (ii) can be used in cosmetics and medicines, as well as in food products. When used commercially, chlorophyllins and chlorophyllins tend to be extracted from plants such as alfalfa, grass and nettles. These dyes are soluble in water, although their intensity can disappear with time. If 100% powder is used it is Halal. Sometimes water or vegetable oil is used as a solvent, then Halal. But sometimes alcohol is used, in this case it is Haram. But it is advisable to be careful as it sometimes contains PIG FAT (Fat Pig) and that's why we put it in the state of Mushbooh

NAME: Copper complexes of chlorophylls and chlorophyllins (i) Copper complexes of chlorophylls (ii) Copper complexes of chlorophyllins
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic dye in food products and beverages. E141 (i) includes chlorophyll copper complexes. It is divided into 2 classes: ul  li E141 (i): Clorophyll Cupric Complex li  li E141 (ii): Cupric Complex of Chlorophyllin li ul These coloring agents provide a tone very similar to olive green. However, E141 (i) and E141 (ii) are more stable forms than E140 (i) and E140 (ii) because the magnesium ion in chlorophyll in E140 (i) and E140 (ii) is replaced by copper in E141 ( i) and E141 (ii). E141 (i) is soluble in water, while E141 (ii) is not soluble in water but is soluble in oil. The copper content of the dyes can be released when heated, but must not reach dangerous levels. If 100% powder is used then it is Halal. Sometimes water or vegetable oil is used as a solvent, then it is Halal. But it is not advisable as it can sometimes contain PIG FAT (Fat Pig) and for this reason this additive is Mushbooh

NAME: Green S
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products. The derivative of the hydrocarbon Trifenilmethane is obtained. E142 is moderately soluble in water, but requires a neutral pH environment to remain stable. In some cases, allergic reactions and anemia have been reported after contact with high concentrations of this dye. Potentially long-term carcinogenic. However, E142 is generally considered safe in small quantities.

NAME: Fast Green FCF (FD&C Green 3)
DESCRIPTION: It is obtained by synthesis from hydrocarbons, specifically benzene. Carcinogenic effects have been found in tests with laboratory animals, as well as mutagenic effects in cell cultures, experimental animals and in humans.

NAME: Caramel
DESCRIPTION: These are used as synthetic coloring agents in food and beverage products. It is dark brown. It is obtained by caramelization with reagents of sugars such as glucose syrup or fructose, extracted from carbohydrates such as corn or wheat, which are the most used in the USA and Europe. It is divided into 4 classes depending on the reagent used in its manufacture: ul  li E150A: Caustic Candy li  li E150B: Caustic Sulfite Caramel li  li E150C: Ammonic Caramel li  li E150D: Ammonium Sulfite Caramel li ul The E150 give a dark brown color to foods and are produced by heat treatment of sucrose. These dyes can sometimes add a bitter taste to the food products that contain them. E150 can also act as an emulsifier in soft drinks. There have been some reported concerns that associate hyperactivity in children with these food colors, although we could not find detailed evidence of this. It is known that E150C and E150D cause intestinal problems if large amounts are consumed and decrease the absorption of Vitamin B6. In the long term they could be carcinogenic, in some places like the State of California in the USA, they have decided to indicate on their labels this ingredient as a possible carcinogen.

DESCRIPTION: Colouring agent. Check E150

NAME: Caustic sulfite caramel
DESCRIPTION: Colouring agent. Check E150

NAME: Ammonia caramel
DESCRIPTION: Colouring agent. Check E150

NAME: Sulfite ammonia caramel
DESCRIPTION: Colouring agent. Check E150

NAME: Black PN, Brilliant Black BN
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products. It is obtained derived from petroleum. E151 is a black synthetic carbon tar and azo dye, and is highly soluble in water. People with intolerance to salicylates may find that they are also intolerant to E151, because the coloration is an azo dye. E151 is also suspected of exacerbating asthma. In the long term it could be carcinogenic.

NAME: Vegetable carbon
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a natural coloring agent in food and beverage products. It is black. It is obtained from the ashes produced by burning wood, coconut shells and other vegetable waste. E153 is produced from burning plant material, but it can also be produced from charcoal. E153 is not soluble in water, which makes it useful as a filtering or clarifying agent, but limits its use in food and beverage products. Halal if used as a 100% dry color. Halal if used as a liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal. Try to avoid it, since sometimes it has PIG FAT (pork fat) (most likely)

NAME: Brown FK (kipper brown)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products. It is derived from petroleum. E154 is a red-brown coloring. It is a mixture of azo dyes, which is highly soluble in water. E154 tends to be used in fish to keep meat a healthy color, even after cooking. It has been found that E154 exacerbates asthma and, when taken in combination with benzoates, can induce hyperactivity in children. People with intolerance to salicylates may also find that they are intolerant to E154, because the coloration is an azo dye. In the long term, it could be carcinogenic. In Europe, it was not possible to guarantee to consumers the safety of this additive, which is why it has now been removed from the official list of additives. Halal if used as a 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as a liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal.

NAME: Brown HT (chocolate brown HT)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products. It is obtained derived from petroleum. E155 is a chocolate colored azo dye, very soluble in water. It acts as an alternative coloration to that provided by cocoa or caramel. E155 can exacerbate asthma symptoms and cause adverse effects in people allergic to aspirin (see also aspirin in the news), as well as skin irritation. People with intolerance to salicylates may also find that they are intolerant to E155, because the coloration is an azo dye. Halal if used as a 100% dry color. Mushbooh if used as a liquid color, the solvent has to be Halal. (no alcohol)

NAME:
- beta-carotenes,synthetic(i)
- beta-carotenes,vegetable(ii)
- beta-carotenes, blakeslea trispora(iii)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a natural coloring agent in food products and beverages. Obtained naturally by extraction in carrots, palm oil and algae or synthetically by microorganism biosynthesis. E160A is a synthetic blend of carotene derived from carrots and is commercially produced on a large scale. However, carotenes also occur naturally in many orange and yellow fruits and vegetables. E160A is not soluble in water and the color intensity tends to fade with exposure to light. Despite being a dye in a natural way, but it is not available in 100% form because it is not soluble in water. Gelatin is added to help mix in liquid products. In the USA UU., Fish gelatin is used, so it is Halal in the USA. UU But in the United Kingdom you can not use fish gelatin, but you can use pork or veal gelatin. For this reason it is Mushbooh.

NAME:
- annatto extracts, bixin-based(i)
- annatto extracts, norbixin-based(ii)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a natural coloring agent in food products and beverages. The E160B is divided into 3 classes: Annato, Bixina and Norbixina. E160B is a yellow to red dye derived from the seeds of the annatto tree (Bixa orellana). Bixin refers to the fat-soluble form of coloration, while norbixin refers to the water soluble form. In addition to being a food additive, E160B can be used as a coloring agent for body paints and can also act as an agent to aid digestion. E160B has now been introduced as an alternative coloration to tartrazine, which is also known as E102. However, there may still be a possibility that E160B causes an allergic reaction.

NAME: Paprika oleoresin: (i) capsanthin, (ii) capsorubin
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a natural coloring agent in food products and beverages. E160C is an intense red coloring and flavoring, derived from red peppers (capsicum annuum). The peppers are dried and ground before extracting the paprika with solvents. Capsanthin can be used in bird foods to increase the color intensity of the egg yolk. In extreme cases, E160C can irritate the eyes and even cause temporary blindness. Eating large amounts can reduce the effectiveness of the taste buds.

NAME: Lycopene
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a natural coloring agent in food products and beverages. E160D is a red coloration that occurs naturally in pink grapefruits, watermelons and tomatoes. When used on a large scale for commercial purposes, the coloration is extracted from the tomatoes. It is not soluble in water but it dissolves in oils and organic solvents. The concentration of lycopene in body tissues is higher than in other carotenoids. Some think that E160D reduces the risk of several types of cancer (including breast cancer and prostate cancer) and heart disease. It is Halal if it is dissolved in oil. It is Mushbooh if it dissolves in organic solvents.

NAME: Beta-apo-8'-carotenal (C 30)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products. E160E is an orange red color and although synthetic when used as a food additive, it is also produced naturally by extraction in carrots, palm oil and algae. As it is not soluble in Water, sometimes the oil is used, in this case it is Halal. But sometimes gelatin is added to help mix in liquid products. In the USA UU., Fish gelatin is used, so it is Halal in the USA. But in the United Kingdom you can not use fish gelatin, but you can use jelly or meat. For this reason it is Mushbooh.

NAME: Ethyl ester of beta-apo-8'-carotenic acid (C 30)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a synthetic coloring agent in food and beverage products. E160F is an orange red color and although synthetic when used as a food additive, palm oil and algae are also produced naturally by extraction in carrots. E160f is partially soluble in water. It occurs naturally in many plants, but can also be produced commercially from E160E. No adverse health effects have been found in relation to the use of E160F. Sometimes gelatin is added to help mix in liquid products. In the United States, fish gelatine is used, so it is Halal. But in the United Kingdom you can not use gelatin from scaling, but you can use gelatin from pork or meat. For this reason it is Mushbooh.

NAME: Flavoxanthin
DESCRIPTION: It is yellow. It is obtained by extracting the petals of Ranunculus (a flower). The halal state depends on what extraction material was used to obtain the pigment which solvent was used for its liquid form. Methanol is sometimes used and that is Haram. For this reason we leave it in the state of Mushbooh.

NAME:
Lutein
- lutein from tagetes erecta((i)
- lutein esters from tagetes erecta(iii)
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a natural coloring agent in food products and beverages. E161B is a yellow orange dye that appears naturally in green leaves, egg whites and marigolds. When required on a commercial scale, E161B is extracted from nettles and grass. This coloration is only partially soluble in water and, therefore, is not widely used. E161B is a xanthophyll (an oxygenated derivative of the carotenes). The halal state depends on what extraction material was used to obtain the pigment which solvent was used for its liquid form. Sometimes methanol (alcohol) is used and that is Haram. For this reason we leave it in the state of Mushbooh.

NAME: Cryptoxanthin
DESCRIPTION: E161C is a natural dye. It is yellow. It is obtained by extracting the petals of Physalis (a flower). The halal state depends on what extraction material was used to obtain the pigment which solvent was used for its liquid form. Methanol (alcohol) is sometimes used and that is Haram. For this reason we leave it in the state of Mushbooh.

NAME: Rubixanthin
DESCRIPTION: E161D is a natural dye. It is red. It is obtained by extraction of Rosa Mosqueta or Escaramujo. The halal state depends on what extraction material was used to obtain the pigment which solvent was used for its liquid form. Methanol is sometimes used (alcohol) and that is Haram. For this reason we leave it in the state of Mushbooh.

NAME: Violaxanthin
DESCRIPTION: It is red. It is obtained by extraction of Thought (a flower). The halal state depends on which extraction material was used to obtain the pigment what solvent was used for its liquid form. Methanol (alcohol) is sometimes used and that is Haram. For this reason we leave it in the state of Mushbooh.

NAME: Rhodoxanthin
DESCRIPTION: E161F is a natural dye. It is purple. It is obtained by extracting the petals of Tejo or Taxus Baccata (a flower). The halal state depends on what extraction material was used to obtain the pigment which solvent was used for its liquid form. Methanol is sometimes used (alcohol) and that is Haram. For this reason we leave it in the state of Mushbooh.

NAME: Canthaxanthin
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a natural coloring agent in food products and beverages. E161G is a yellow orange dye that occurs naturally in various plants and birds. When prepared on a commercial scale, the dye is derived from flamingo mushrooms and feathers. E161G is a xanthophyll (an oxygenated derivative of the carotenes). In addition to food, coloration is used in self-tanning products. Some studies have indicated that frequent and prolonged close contact with E161G may cause spots on the retina of the eye due to the formation of crystals. It is also suspected that this coloration causes damage to the liver with a prolonged ingestion.    The halal state depends on which extraction material it was used to obtain the pigment which solvent was used for its liquid form. Methanol (alcohol) is sometimes used and that is Haram. For this reason we leave it in the state of Mushbooh.

NAME: Zeaxanthin
DESCRIPTION: E161H is used as a natural coloring agent in food products and beverages. It has a yellow color and is soluble in water. E161H is obtained by extracting several species of dry plants such as algae. E161H there is no secondary effect on health. Sometimes the extraction of E161H does not come synthetically or vegetable, but animal origin and for this reason we mark it as Mushbooh.

NAME: Citranaxanthin
DESCRIPTION: E161I is a dye in synthetic form. The E161I is used very little, with the exception of bird food to dye chicken fat and egg yolks. The E161I is not listed as a food additive for human consumption by the United States FDA.

NAME: Astaxanthin
DESCRIPTION: E161J is a dye in a synthetic or natural way. It has a red color and is obtained naturally by extraction of fatty fish crabs, molluscs and crustaceans. It is used in salmon and chickens so that their meat or eggs have a more intense color when it is commercialized. No side effects of additive E161J are known. The E161J is not widely used.

NAME: Beetroot Red, Betanin
DESCRIPTION: E162 is used as a natural coloring agent in food products and beverages. E162 is a red purple dye, derived from beet. Although widely used, E162 is unstable because it degrades in the presence of light, oxygen and high temperatures. E162 may contain nitrates and, therefore, should not be consumed by infants and young children. No other reports of adverse effects were found during our search. Depending on what material are used for the extraction phase, Halal solvents are sometimes used and Harama is sometimes used as methanol (alcohol). For this reason we leave it in the state of Mushbooh.

NAME: Anthocyanins
DESCRIPTION: It is used as a natural coloring agent in food products and beverages. E163 is a blue, red, violet, purple and brown dye derived from the cellular sap of plants, vegetables, fruits (black grapes, raspberries, cherries, cranberries) and flowers. They are divided into 6 categories: E163A, E163B, E163C, E163D, E163E, E163F, E163 is soluble in water and may contain sugars and minerals. It has anti-inflammatory properties and acts as an antioxidant when it is found in fruits and vegetables. Reports suggest that when consumed in adequate amounts, it is thought that this natural dye benefits human health.

NAME: Saffron
DESCRIPTION: E164 is an additive made of dark yellow to dark red carotenoid pigments, mainly crocin and crocetina of gardenias fruits (economical version) or flower stigmas of Crocus sativus (saffron, much more expensive). There is no information available on the extraction, chemical or natural, of the principle of dyeing. It could contain allergenic components when it comes to saffron. Natural saffron and crocin would have beneficial and protective properties for health.

NAME: Calcium carbonate(i),
DESCRIPTION: E170 is a natural color, white to gray. E170 is a natural mineral present in sedimentary rocks and the most common form of which is limestone; It is also found in chalk, marble, coral and as a main component of egg shells, snails and marine animals. To date, the commercial form of calcium carbonate it is obtained from the grinding of limestone or by precipitation of calcareous ions with carbonate ions (precipitated calcium carbonate). It is divided into 2 classes: ul li Calcium Carbonate (E170i) li li Calcium Bicarbonate (E170ii) li ul It is commonly used in medicine as a calcium supplement or as an antacid, but excessive consumption can be dangerous.

NAME: Chalk
DESCRIPTION: E171 is used as a natural coloring agent in food products and beverages. E171 is a white dye that is used to give opacity to food products. E171 is inert (not reactive) and is also used in the manufacture of paint and as a paper coating. At room temperature, E171 generally has the structure of rutile  (its mineral form). Titanium dioxide is extracted from the mineral ilmenite. In large doses it can block cellular respiration, especially in organs such as the liver and kidneys. It can be manufactured in various ways, including by isolation of gluten, casein or keratin (animal proteins), by hydrolysis of proteins (edestine, hemoglobin, zein) by bromination followed by amination of isocaproic acid from hydantoin. In low doses, no side effects have been found, but in large doses it can cause stomach upset, prevent the absorption of other amino acids and cause an increase in ammonia levels in the blood, which can be toxic to the liver and kidneys. This additive can be of vegetable origin, in this case it is Halal. But sometimes it may come from animal origin, in this case it is Haram. For this reason it is Mushbooh.

It is also used as a dietary supplement, in cold packs and in the treatment of acne.

But in large doses can cause kidney problems, liver and nervous system. There are reports where there is a carcinogenic risk.

DESCRIPTION: Beeswax is the particular wax secreted by honey bees, which they use to build honeycombs. Beeswax can initially contain impurities because it has a strong affinity for industrial pollutants and pesticides. It is divided into 2 classes: White Beeswax and Yellow Beeswax.    In low doses, no side effects have been found. But it must be said that in some cases this substance is not reabsorbed by the body, difficult to digest. And also the allergy is sometimes reported at the level of cosmetics with this substance.

NAME: Candelilla wax
DESCRIPTION: Natural substance extracted from the leaves and stems of the bushes Euphorbia antisyphilitica (candelilla) and Euphorbia cerifera, mainly from the desert of northern Mexico. The wax is extracted by treatment with sulfuric acid and, naturally, contains almost 50% of hydrocarbons. No side effects were found.

NAME: Carnauba wax
DESCRIPTION: Carnauba wax comes from the leaves of a palm tree located partially in northeastern Brazil, Copernicia prunifera. This wax is obtained by threshing the leaves, followed by refining and sometimes fading.    In low doses, no side effects have been found. But it must be said that in some cases it can cause small allergic reactions. Carnauba wax is also widely used in cosmetics and can cause eczema.

NAME: Shellac
DESCRIPTION: The Shellac is a lacquer that results from the secretion of an Asian cochineal, Kerria lacca. The resin obtained is yellow red amber, generally supplied in the form of flakes that dissolve in 95 ° alcohol. The mixture obtained can be used in the manufacture of cabinets or in the manufacture of violins for varnishing wood. Other applications are the food industry, pharmaceutical products, the manufacture of adhesives or inks. It is divided into 2 classes: White Lacquer Gum and Orange Lacquer Gum. No side effects have been found. But sometimes they are suspected to be allergenic. It has an allergenic potential by contact, with proven cases of allergic reactions when used as a cosmetic ingredient.

NAME: Paraffins
DESCRIPTION: The paraffins are now obtained in oil refineries. They do not stick. They are not a binder, unlike beeswax (E901) and some vegetable waxes. Microcrystalline wax is produced from waste when motor oils are conditioned. White, odorless wax is used as an ointment base or as a preservative for metal objects. No side effects have been found in low doses. But in some cases there may be some difficulty in the absorption of many nutrients, minerals and vitamins. Beware of pregnant women, it is better to avoid it. It is known that the additive contains traces of at least one polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH), benzo (a) pyrene, which is very toxic.

NAME: Mineral oil
DESCRIPTION: A mineral oil is a mixture derived from the distillation of certain fossil fuels. It is obtained by distillation of coal, oil or certain oil shales and serves mainly as a lubricant for mechanical parts of machines and engines. Outside the U.E., it is sometimes used in the food industry, especially in confectionery. According to the US FDA UU (2015), the mineral oil that is eaten in or near meals interferes with the absorption of provitamin A and the fat-soluble vitamins A, D and K, and consequently with the use of calcium and phosphorus. , exposing itself to diseases related to deficiencies. The mineral oils of aromatic hydrocarbons can be mutagenic and carcinogenic. Daily intake: Up to 20 mg kg of body weight.

The less refined categories are used industrially and may contain impurities such as polycyclic aromatic carcinogens. A laxative effect is possible. It can irritate or interfere with digestion, inhibit the absorption of fats and fat-soluble vitamins. It can be dangerous in high doses. A contact allergy (dermatitis) is possible.

It is unlikely that the pure substance and or its dye will cause irritation, allergy or contact dermatitis. The E906 additive is rarely used as a food additive. It is used in cosmetics, perfumery and pharmaceuticals.

Polydecene is also found in motor oils for automobiles, cosmetics, shampoos, lipsticks and some pharmaceutical products, such as skin care creams and anti-odor bars. This additive toxicity is high because in high doses can cause poor absorption of vitamins and minerals. It can cause hemorrhages in pregnant women. Recent WHO studies showed that traces of mineral oils were found in the liver and lymph.

NAME: Rice bran wax
DESCRIPTION: Rice bran wax is a vegetable wax extracted from rice bran oil (Oryza sativa). Its main components are aliphatic acids (wax acids) and esters. Rice bran oil is obtained by making white or polished rice (which is actually the endosperm of Oryza sativa L., grass seed). A refined wax extracted from rice bran. The refining involves one or more chemical treatments and the consequent loss of nutritional intake. The use of solvents during the production process also implies the presence of residual traces generally toxic. Rice bran wax is found in a variety of uses such as paper coating, textiles, fruit and vegetable coatings, pharmaceuticals, chewing gum and cosmetics.

NAME: Spermaceti wax
DESCRIPTION: The white of the whale is a white substance in the head of certain cetaceans, like the sperm whale. The corresponding organ is called the spermaceti organ. It is extracted from the spermaceti oil by crystallization during a pressure treatment and an alkaline chemical solution. Due to its properties, the target of the whale was very sought after for the realization of candles, soaps, cosmetics, lubricants or similar pharmaceutical excipients.

NAME: Wax esters
DESCRIPTION: Esters of a fatty acid and a long-chain alcohol. These oils have properties similar to those of triglycerides, but they are not digestible. They are found in some fish like the orange clock. Wax esters are also found in certain plants, especially in jojoba, and in some bacteria, such as certain Acinetobacter, in which they are used as energy reserves. Currently no side effects have been found. If its origin is of fatty acid in this case it is Haram. But if its origin is of plants in this case it is Halal. For this reason it is Mushbooh.

DESCRIPTION: The methyl esters of the fatty acids are organic aliphatic esters prepared essentially by reaction of a carboxylic acid (derived from natural fats and oils) and methanol. They consist of fatty acids of animal or vegetable origin. They are used indirectly in a wide range of foods, pharmaceuticals, cosmetics and industrial applications, especially as diesel biofuels or biodiesel. No one has been able to participate at this time. It can be derived from vegetable oils such as rapeseed and, therefore, a transgenic biotechnology. The esterification is carried out using ethylene glycol, 1,3-butanediol or triols. In 2013, given the limitations of toxicological data, the Scientific Committee of EFSA concluded that the additive could not be evaluated Some sources report it as acceptable or without known side effects. But there are some sources that report it as an additive to avoid, suspected of being allergic and carcinogenic. The origin of this additive can be vegetable, in this case it is halal. But on other occasions it can come from animal (not sacrificed in the name of Allah), in this case it is Haram. For this reason it is Mushbooh.

NAME: Lanolin, sheep wool grease
DESCRIPTION: A yellow fat secreted by the sebaceous glands of the sheep and extracted from their wool. Used as an emollient, cosmetic and pharmaceutical auxiliary. This complex mixture of esters of alcohols and fatty acids is chemically classified as wax and naturally serves as a waterproofing agent for wool animals. It is used as a glaze in some traditional sweets, and to give a bright coating to candies and chewing gum. It is also used to produce vitamin D3, natural cosmetics, balms, moisturizing ointments, emollient products, lipsticks, cocoa, lip repair and extra moisturizing creams. Its toxicity is very low, although in some cases it can cause allergic reactions of small intensity. There is little information about its use in food. The origin of this additive is animal, specifically sheep. In the case of being in a Muslim state it is Halal since this animal has been sacrificed in the name of Allah. But in the case of this in a non-Muslim state it is possible that this animal is not sacrificed in the name of allah, in this case it is Haram. For this reason it is Mushbooh.

In 1991, studies by FAO and WHO showed that there were traces of mineral oils in the liver and lymph, and in 1995 this same Committee showed that certain lesions could be observed in rats as well as in humans due to residues of said oils The pure substance (powder form) shows some signs of carcinogenic activity in laboratory animals, but it is not classified as carcinogenic in humans.

Colophony is an irritant and allergen for the skin (dermatitis) and respiratory tract (asthma), in pure form or by its degradation products, without the mechanisms of action are still well known. Pure rosin is dangerous by ingestion, it can be toxic to the lungs and skin. The ester of rosin is used in the manufacture of beverages and chewing gum, in the coatings industry (manufacture of lacquers, paints, varnishes), pharmaceuticals (see rosin) and cosmetics.

NAME: Calcium iodate
DESCRIPTION: Calcium salt of iodine acid, prepared by passing chlorine in a solution of hot lime containing dissolved iodine. Iodines are used particularly in medicine for iodine deficiency, the treatment of goiter and the protection of the thyroid in the radioactive perimeters. Possible nausea at therapeutic doses. To date, iodates are not listed as food additives (that is, with an 'E' code) for the European Union, however, they are allowed in more specific food fields, such as mineral salts that are added to cereals and baby food, as well as iodized animal supplements.

NAME: Potassium iodate
DESCRIPTION: Iodine as a pure substance is a powerful oxidizing agent, mainly poisoned by the GI tract and direct toxicity against the cells of the retina. May cause a fire in contact with flammable or even combustible materials. Iodine is used especially in medicines for iodine deficiency and the treatment of thyroid hyperplasia and the protection of the thyroid in radioactive oceans. Possible nausea at therapeutic doses. To date, iodine has not been included as a food additive (that is, with the E symbol) of the European Union, but its use is permitted in more specific food areas, such as: mineral salts added to cereals and baby food.

NAME: Nitrogen oxides
DESCRIPTION: Nitric oxide can be manufactured industrially by passing air through an electric arc by oxidizing the ammonia to a platinum gauze. Nitrogen dioxide is produced by oxidation of nitric acid. Nitrogen oxides are proven pollutants, harmful both to the environment and to health. It has been reported that nitrogen dioxide as a pure substance, among other things, reacts with the blood and forms methemoglobin.

NAME: Nitrosyl chloride
DESCRIPTION: Nitrosyl chloride is a yellow gas that is most often found as a decomposition product of aqua regia, a mixture of hydrochloric acid and nitric acid. It can be manufactured in various ways, including by the reaction of chlorine with sodium nitrate. Very toxic gas in its pure state. Pure nitrosyl chloride is a highly toxic and corrosive gas. Inhalation causes severe irritation of the respiratory tract and damages the mucous membranes.

NAME: L-cysteine
DESCRIPTION: Cysteine is an amino acid found in a wide variety of foods, especially cereals. It participates in the synthesis of melanin, which is the natural pigment of the skin and hair. It can be obtained, among other things, by dissolving with hydrochloric acid feathers, pig hair or even human hair. This last mode of production is prohibited today. The origin of this additive can come from human hair or from some animal like the pig, in this case it is Haram. But sometimes it can be manufactured in a synthetic way (but it is economically more expensive), in this case it is Halal. For this reason it is Mushbooh.

NAME: L-cystine
DESCRIPTION: Cysteine is an amino acid found in a wide variety of foods, especially cereals. It participates in the synthesis of melanin, which is the natural pigment of the skin and hair. It can be obtained, among other things, by dissolving with hydrochloric acid feathers, pig hair or even human hair. This last mode of production is prohibited today. The origin of this additive can come from human hair or from some animal like the pig, in this case it is Haram. But sometimes it can be manufactured in a synthetic way (but it is economically more expensive), in this case it is Halal. For this reason it is Mushbooh.

NAME: Potassium persulfate
DESCRIPTION: Potassium persulfate is a potassium salt of peroxydisulfuric acid. The latter is an oxo acid of sulfur, a strong oxidant that is used, among other things, in certain metal pickling. Pure potassium persulfate is classified as harmful and dangerous. If ingested it is irritating to the eyes, the skin and the respiratory tract, it is a sensitizer, its combustion can produce corrosive and toxic gases, while the waste can contaminate the environment.

NAME: Ammonium persulfate
DESCRIPTION: Ammonium salt of peroxydisulfuric acid (or Marshall acid). The latter is an oxo acid of sulfur (a compound containing sulfur, oxygen and hydrogen), it is in its pure state a strong oxidant that is used, among other things, in certain metal pickling. Ammonium is naturally present in our body as a waste of metabolism, comes from the breakdown of proteins and is essentially produced by the intestine, kidneys and muscles (depleted by stress) to be eliminated by the liver. It is a compound additive that is very harmful to humans. Pure ammonium persulfate is a compound that is harmful by ingestion and is very destructive to mucous membranes, is not stable with water and is incompatible with organic matter.

NAME: Potassium bromate
DESCRIPTION: Potassium salt of bromic acid, a synthetic compound that can be produced by passing bromine to a solution of potassium hydroxide. A pure substance is recognized as toxic by ingestion, inhalation or contact. In particular, it is incompatible with organic matter. It is very dangerous for the human. There are official reports that it can be carcinogenic to humans. It is not advisable to avoid this additive. Potassium bromate is also a cosmetic component (used as neutralizers or oxidants in hair curling preparations) and is also used as an industrial cleanser.

NAME: Calcium bromate
DESCRIPTION: Calcium salt of bromic acid, a synthetic compound that can be produced by passing bromine to a solution of calcium hydroxide. A pure substance is recognized as toxic by ingestion, inhalation or contact. In particular, it is incompatible with organic matter. It is very dangerous for the human. There are official reports that it can be carcinogenic to humans. It is not advisable to avoid this additive. Calcium bromate is also a cosmetic component (used as neutralizers or oxidants in hair curling preparations) and is also used as an industrial cleanser.

NAME: Chlorine
DESCRIPTION: Chlorine as a single substance is a gas with a stifling odor that is very unpleasant and extremely toxic. In nature, chlorine is found only in combination with other elements, particularly sodium chloride (table salt), in this form it is necessary for many life forms. Its use for the disinfection of drinking water or pools generates dangerous products for our health. E925 is used as a flour treatment (bleaching) agent. It is also used for pharmaceuticals, cosmetics, the production of antiseptics, dyes, insecticides, paints and others.

NAME: Chlorine dioxide (preservative)
DESCRIPTION: Chlorine dioxide is prepared synthetically, it is a reddish yellow gas. It is relatively stable in its gaseous and liquid state. In practice, it is never used in pure form. It is known that the pure substance is very toxic by ingestion, inhalation and contact, is particularly incompatible with organic matter and forms hydrogen chloride with water. E926 is used as a flour treatment (bleaching) agent. It is also used for pharmaceuticals, cosmetics, the production of antiseptics, dyes, insecticides, paints and others.

NAME: Azodicarbonamide
DESCRIPTION: The raw materials used or used in the production are sodium hydroxide, sulfuric acid (E513), hydrogen peroxide, urea (E927b), chlorine (E925), hydrazinium. Sodium hypochlorite (bleach), sodium chlorate, chromic acid, nitrogen dioxide (E918) and biurea. Chemically, pure azodicarbonamide is harmful and can act as a respiratory and cutaneous sensitizer, acute effects are a possibility of gastrointestinal disorders. Azodicarbonamide is bound to urea, the main waste excreted in the urine. It is used in flour with low gluten content to condition and strengthen the dough. And it is also used to whiten flour.

NAME: Carbamide (urea)
DESCRIPTION: This additive is synthesized from ammonia and carbon dioxide. According to the JECFA informed by the WHO, the use at levels of up to 3% in chewing gum (only foods allowed to date, undated) is not a cause for concern. It is known that the pure substance causes acute effects (ingestion) nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diuretic effect and sore throat. Data among other mutagens, reprotoxic and tumorigenic reported by the American RTECS. Some other users: pharmaceutical products, cosmetics, ruminants of reproduction (urea as a nutritional additive in the diet, some sectors of differentiated quality prohibit their use), teeth whitening (carbamide peroxide).

NAME: Benzoyl peroxide (improving agent)
DESCRIPTION: The manufacture of this benzoic acid peroxide, which is opaque to an uninitiated chemical, results from the reaction of the benzoyl chloride with sodium hydroxide or peroxide and or hydrogen peroxide. This product explodes in the dry state with shock, friction or high temperature. It is known that the pure substance is very dangerous by ingestion (acute or chronic effects). It is also very reactive and oxidizing, it is an explosive when it is not diluted. E928 is used for pharmaceutical products (including anti-acne with possible side effects), cosmetics as an active ingredient in teeth whitening systems, hair dyes and others.

NAME: Acetone peroxide
DESCRIPTION: Acetone peroxide is a primary explosive discovered in 1895 by Richard Wolffenstein. It is a family of unstable molecules that consist of cyclic organic peroxides. More often it is in the form of a white crystalline powder. It has a characteristic pungent smell. Pure acetone peroxide is a compound known to be very unstable and explosive. It is made of hydrogen peroxide and acetone, two chemicals that are questionable or harmful by ingestion.

NAME: Calcium peroxide (improving agent)
DESCRIPTION: Calcium peroxide dissolves in acids to form hydrogen peroxide. Pure calcium peroxide is a strong oxidizing agent with acute effects and is corrosive and very dangerous by ingestion, inhalation and contact. The users of calcium peroxide are cosmetics, agriculture, aquaculture and soil restoration and others.

NAME: Argon
DESCRIPTION: Argon is a rare, colorless, tasteless and odorless gas that constitutes 0.9% of the air we breathe in the earth, it is used as a propellant (in aerosols) and gas for packaging. Its non-reactive nature makes it compatible with food products. Products without oxygen are protected against oxidation damage and are also protected against the invasion of bacteria and fungi. Obtained commercially by distillation of liquid air. No side effects were found.

NAME: Helium
DESCRIPTION: Helium is a gas. It is used as a propellant and as a stabilizer for packaged products. Including products sensitive to air or oxygen, such as dairy products. Like other noble gases, helium is extremely stable and does not easily form compounds with other elements. Helium, which is neutral under standard conditions, is non-toxic, has no biological role and is found in minute quantities in human blood. For large-scale use, helium is extracted by fractional distillation of natural gas, which can contain up to 7%. No side effects have been found. In large quantities it causes the voice to become sharper for a few seconds.

NAME: Dichlorodifluoromethane
DESCRIPTION: The dichlorodifluoromethane E940 is listed as gaz propellant. The E940 is used as an additive for food and cosmetics. Dichlorodifluoromethane is also sold under the name Freon-12 or R12 according to the list of fluorinated and refrigerant gases, it is a chlorofluorocarbon dangerous to the ozone layer and is used as a propellant in aerosols until its manufacture was banned in 1995. This is a greenhouse gas used as a propellant in aerosols. According to the consulted sources, the additive E940 can be reported as toxic, it is not particularly good for human health but there are few risks in low doses, on the other hand, in large doses it can be carcinogenic.

NAME: Nitrogen (packaging gas)
DESCRIPTION: Nitrogen is a gas. It is used as a propellant and as a stabilizer for packaged products. It is also used as a freezing agent, especially in some kitchens they use it for desserts (such as to aerate some creams or mousses in order to give it more creaminess).    No side effects have been found.

NAME: Nitrous oxide
DESCRIPTION: Natural greenhouse gas, manufactured chemically from ammonium nitrate. Also called nitrous oxide, it is classified as a pollutant by the Kyoto Protocol. Sometimes it is reported to be toxic, but it is considered safe if it is used only as a propellant in the diet and not in high doses. Its use is not recommended during the first trimester of pregnancy. Nitrous oxide is also found in: pharmaceuticals (general anesthesia) and cosmetics (propellant).

NAME: Butane
DESCRIPTION: Butane is obtained from petroleum fractions by pressure distillation of G.P.L (liquefied petroleum gases). It is also a component of lit cigarettes. Butane is used or intended to be used to displace or suppress oxygen in the processing, storage or packaging of beverage products and other foods, with the exception of fresh meat. It is a propeller in pastry pumps made of vegetable oil. No side effects known to date in the use of food. There are carcinogenic effects in laboratory animals. In high doses, pure butane is potentially narcotic. Butane E 943a contains very small and harmful residual amounts: methane and butadiene (a known carcinogen).

NAME: Isobutane
DESCRIPTION: The hydrocarbon is found as a gas under normal conditions of temperature and pressure. The main source of isobutane is the refining of crude oil by catalytic or reformed cracking and natural gas fields. Very flammable It can ignite in the presence of static electricity. It is particularly a propeller in vegetable oil-based pastry pumps. This gas is odorless and colorless and the odor is so strong that the cylinders are added later for greater safety in the event of a gas leak. It is used as fuel, solvent, coolant and food additive. It is used in aerosols such as oil sprays, butter, cream and other products.

NAME: Propane
DESCRIPTION: Gas derived from other petroleum products by thermochemical processes of gas or oil. It is commonly used as a source of chemical energy by combustion in internal combustion engines, barbecues and boilers. It is used as fuel, solvent, coolant and food additive. It is used, among other things, for vegetable oils and aqueous emulsions to spray. It is also used as a propellant in cosmetics, pharmaceuticals, as well as fuel or fuel.

NAME: Chloropentafluoroethane
DESCRIPTION: Chloropentafluoroethane is a chlorofluorocarbon (CFC) used as a refrigerant. It is a transparent, colorless gas with an ethereal smell. Vapors may cause dizziness or suffocation without warning. Contact with this gas or liquefied gas can cause burns, serious injury and or freezing. It is prohibited by the Montreal Protocol because of its potential to destroy ozone. This prohibition does not affect industrial foods and certain medical applications.

NAME: Octafluorocyclobutane
DESCRIPTION: Transparent, colorless gas with an ethereal (weak) odor. Octafluorocyclobutane vapors may cause dizziness or suffocation without warning. Fire can produce irritating, corrosive and or toxic gases. In animals, the acute effects of this pure gas by inhalation are: possibility of cardiac arrhythmia, possibility of bronchoconstriction.

NAME: Oxygen
DESCRIPTION: Oxygen, commonly known as oxygen, is a transparent, colorless, odorless, tasteless and non-flammable gas. It is obtained by distillation of the air. It is used in aerosols such as oil sprays, butter, cream and other products. It is also used for packaging.

NAME: Hydrogen
DESCRIPTION: Hydrogen, commonly known as hydrogen, is a colorless and odorless natural gas, very abundant, present in water and all organic components. It is obtained by natural gas catalysis. It is the most abundant element in the universe. It is used in aerosols such as oil sprays, butter, cream and other products. It is also used for packaging.

NAME: Acesulfame potassium
DESCRIPTION: This additive is approximately 200 times sweeter than sugar, stable to heat. As it has a bitter taste, it is usually combined with other sweeteners such as Aspartame and Sucralose. It is used in many products labeled without sugar, 0% sugar, 0% sugars, sugar free, etc. According to a 2005 study tested in mice, it is interpreted that consumed in the long term could be carcinogenic (with higher incidence of cancer in males) and be linked to neurological problems, hyperglycemia and insulin secretion.

NAME: Aspartame
DESCRIPTION: Synthetic low calorie sweetener. It is obtained from the mixture of 3 components: 50% Phenylalanine, 40% Aspartic Acid and 10% Methyl Ester. It is up to 200 times sweeter than sugar. It is used in many products labeled without sugar , 0% sugar , 0% sugars , sugar free , etc. There are reports that show that there are more common side effects such as weight deregulation, the formation of different forms of cancer and the effect on the brain. A synthetic sweetener but alcohol is used during processing. In this case it is Haram

NAME:
- cyclamic acid (i)
- calcium cyclamate (ii)
- sodium cyclamate (iv)
DESCRIPTION: It is obtained by a reaction of Cyclohexylamine with Sulfamic Acid or Sulfur Trioxide. This additive is a synthetic low calorie sweetener. It is up to 40 times sweeter than ordinary sugar, but at the same time it is the artificial sweetener with less sweetness. It is divided into 3 classes: Cyclamic Acid, Sodium Cyclamate and Calcium Cyclamate. After several investigations, this additive is considered very toxic and could cause cancer if its consumption is not controlled. It is advisable to avoid this additive.

NAME: Isomalt, Isomaltitol
GROUP:
anticaking agent,
bulking agent,
glazing agent,
stabilizer, sweetener, thickener
DESCRIPTION: Isomalt is obtained by catalytic hydrogenation (nickel) of isomaltulose prepared by enzymatic isomerization of sucrose. No side effects have been found. But in large doses can cause flatulations and diarrhea, like many other sugar alcohols.

NAME:
- saccharin (i)
- calcium saccharin (ii)
- potassium saccharin (iii)
- sodium saccharin (iv)
DESCRIPTION: This artificial sweetening additive can be produced from toluene (methylbenzene), anthranilic acid (successive reaction with nitrous acid, sulfur dioxide, chlorine and ammonia). Carcinogenic effects have been observed in guinea pigs. Subsequently, additional studies under the pressure of the food industry led to the elimination of this warning. In low doses can present great risks of allergies. In large doses it causes bladder cancer in rats. This product contains saccharin, which causes cancer in laboratory animals.

NAME: Sucralose (Trichlorogalactosucrose)
DESCRIPTION: Synthetic low calorie sweetener. It is up to 600 times sweeter than sugar. It is used in many products labeled without sugar , 0% sugar , 0% sugars, sugar free , etc. In large doses causes the destruction of the immune system affecting mainly the liver and kidneys. There are many studies that show that it can cause severe DNA damage.

NAME: Alitame
DESCRIPTION: Synthetic low calorie sweetener. It is up to 2000 times sweeter than sugar. It is used in many products labeled without sugar , 0% sugar , 0% sugars , sugar free , etc. No side effects have been found at the moment. But it is an additive that does not have much information about its toxicity in humans.

NAME: Thaumatin (sweetener)
DESCRIPTION: Sweetener 1600 to 3000 times sweeter than natural sugar. Thaumatin is a sugar protein, traditionally derived from the fruit of the African tropical plant katemfe. Its flavor is persistent, with a slight liqueur taste and its properties are used to modify flavors and not exclusively as a sweetener. Thaumatin, consumed in high doses, seems to have mild laxative effects and cause mild abdominal pain, but the doses that should be ingested to know these drawbacks are extremely important.

NAME: Glycyrrhizin (sweetener)
DESCRIPTION: Natural sweetener. It is derived from the licorice root. It has an aniseed and bittersweet flavor. It is used as a substitute for sugar because it does not produce caries and is suitable for diabetics. In high doses, glycyrrhizin may aggravate hypertension, water retention, hypokalemia (low potassium level) and other possible symptoms.

NAME: Neohesperidine dihydrochalcone (sweetener)
DESCRIPTION: Synthetic sweetener and flavor enhancer. It is obtained by synthesis of a substance called 'neohesperidin' present in bitter oranges. It is usually used together with other sweeteners. It is up to 1800 times sweeter than normal sugar. Its flavor is persistent, with a slight licorice taste and is used to mask bitter flavors. NHDC is often presented as not dangerous. But in large doses it causes nausea and migraines.

NAME: Steviol glycosides
DESCRIPTION: A natural sweetener extracted from the Stevia plant, 200 to 300 times sweeter than sucrose. The additive is obtained from the leaves of Stevia rebaudiana Bertoni. The leaves are extracted with hot water and the aqueous extract is passed through an adsorption resin to trap and concentrate the components of the steviol glycoside. Some studies indicate that it could have long-term negative effects. Other studies indicate that only these negative effects occur in very high doses and that previous studies are directed by producers of chemical sweeteners and sugar companies that try to damage the image of Stevia.

NAME: Neotame
DESCRIPTION: Synthetic low calorie sweetener and flavor enhancer. It is obtained by chemical reaction of Aspartame with dimethylbutyl (dimethyl butyraldehyde), a compound that reduces the amount of phenylalanine and thus eliminates the obligation to include warnings about the risks of consumption of phenylalanine in the labeling of products. It is up to 13,000 times sweeter than sugar. This additive is considered toxic and perhaps worse than aspartame, it is better to avoid it.

NAME: Aspartame-acesulfame salt (sweetener)
DESCRIPTION: This additive is manufactured by the mixture of aspartame E951 and acesulfame E950. It is up to 350 times sweeter than sugar. It is used in general in many products labeled as 'sugar free', '0% sugar', 'light', 'zero', 'zero' and 'low in calories'. An additive to avoid is classified as a carcinogen by the association for therapeutic research against cancer.

NAME: Maltitol (i) Maltitol (ii) Maltitol syrup (sweetener) (stabiliser)
DESCRIPTION: Synthetic low calorie sweetener and support for additives. It is obtained from the sugars of malt. It is 25% less sweet than normal sugar. It is marketed under the brands Amalty, Lesys, Maltisweet and SweetPearl. It is divided into two types of classes: Maltitol and Maltitol Syrup.

NAME: Lactitol
DESCRIPTION: Lactitol is a sugar alcohol (polyol) and is derived chemically from milk, specifically lactose, the sugar in milk. Its sweetness is approximately 50% less sweet than natural sugar. For the final product to be quite sweet, lactitol is often combined with the sweeteners aspartame (E 951) and acefulsame-K (E 950). In small doses it can be laxative, cause diarrhea, flatulence and cramps. In large doses can cause colic. It should be avoided in children under 3 years. This additives comes from a sugar alcohol, Halal if it is obtained from halal serum or lactose. If animal rennet is used to make serum and lactose, then lactitol is haram. For this reason it is Mushbooh.

NAME: Xylitol
DESCRIPTION: Synthetic sweetener. It is obtained by acid hydrolysis of the 'xylose sugar' present in the vegetable fibers of birch wood, corn cobs, sugarcane pulp, seed pods and coconut shell. It has a sweetness and a taste very similar to normal sugar but with 35% less calories and a refreshing touch menthol in the mouth due to the cooling effect that produces upon contact with the tongue.  It is used as a substitute for sugar because it does not produce caries and has a very low glycemic index, which makes it optimal for diabetics. In addition, anticaries effects are attributed to it, which makes it possibly one of the best sweeteners. It is a controversial additive, studies in rats have revealed cancer in some of the guinea pigs, but JECFA could not assess the adequacy of males in rats. It is cataloged as definitively carcinogenic by the Association for Therapeutic Research Against Cancer.

NAME: Erythritol
DESCRIPTION: Present naturally in some fruits, vegetables and fermented foods, but the industrial production of erythritol is obtained by fermenting the flour (wheat and or corn) and could be derived from GMOs. Fermentation and due to the hydrolyzed enzyme and to an osmophilic yeast. The sweetening power of erythritol is 60 to 80% of the sugar. No side effects have been found. In large doses it can have a laxative effect.

NAME: Quillaia extract
DESCRIPTION: It is obtained from a South American tree. It is often used in supplements and slimming pills to satisfy hunger. Some reports say it is harmless while others consider it toxic to the blood and that it can cause intestinal inflammation. This additive is Haram because the extraction of the sub-tree from the soap bark tree is extracted with alcohol.

NAME: Cholic acid
DESCRIPTION: Part of the bile of vertebrates, colic acid is one of the two main bile acids produced by the liver, where it is synthesized from cholesterol. Extract of cow bile, can be produced synthetically. Colorless plates or a white crystalline powder. There are no known side effects to date. It is also used in the manufacture of pharmaceutical products.

NAME: Choline salts
DESCRIPTION: Choline is an essential nutrient generally classified in the class of vitamins B. Choline is widely present in the diet. The reason for the use of this additive is an agent that forms or preserves a mixture of substances normally incapable of mixing, for example: oil and water There is no known secondary effect. This additive seems to be widely used in baby foods.

NAME: Amylase
DESCRIPTION: A digestive enzyme classified as saccharidase (an enzyme that breaks polysaccharides, especially starches, into sugars). The origin of this additive is the pancreas of pigs, green mold and genetic engineering. Amylase is also synthesized in many fruit species during ripening, which makes them sweeter and also during the germination of cereals. This additive is used especially in bakery. The origin of this additive may come from plant origin in this case is Halal. But it can also come from animal origin, in this case the pig pancreas, in this case it is Haram. For this reason this additive is Mushbooh

NAME: Proteases ((i)Protease, (ii)Papain, (iii)Bromelain, (iv)Ficin)
DESCRIPTION: Natural proteases are very abundant enzymes in the living realm, they break the peptide bonds of proteins. Their biological functions are varied: they intervene in the maturation of proteins, the digestion of food, the blood coagulation, the remodeling of tissues during the development of the organism and the healing. It is divided into 4 classes: Peptidase, Papain, Bromelain and Ficin. It is also used in the kitchen to soften meat, and in alcoholic beverages. Proteases are also inserted into some pharmaceutical products. The origin of this additive can be vegetable (of a plant), in this case it is Halal. But it can also be obtained in an animal way, in this case it is Haram. For this reason it is Mushbooh. Look at the product labeling to make sure it is Halal.

NAME: Glucose oxidase
DESCRIPTION: Natural glucose oxidase is an oxidoreductase enzyme that in cells helps break down sugar into its metabolites. Commercially, the additive is biosynthesized from microorganisms (fungi) Aspergillus niger or penicillium notatum. It can also be inserted into cosmetic products.

NAME: Invertase
DESCRIPTION: This additive is used in many foods. In the food industry, such as bees, invertase is used to produce invert sugar by dividing sucrose into a molecule of fructose and glucose and, therefore, improving the shelf life of the products. Industrial invertase is extracted from yeasts. The resulting mixture of these sugars is called 'invert sugar' and the most common form is honey, which is a supersaturated mixture of glucose and fructose. No side effects have been found.

NAME: Lipases
DESCRIPTION: Lipases are specialized enzymes in the transformation of triglycerides into glycerol and fatty acids. They are produced by the glands of the tongue and pancreas and initiate the digestion of dietary fat. Commercially, they are usually of animal origin (pig pancreas), but they can also be synthesized biologically by microorganisms. The origin of this additive may come from plant origin in this case is Halal. But it can also come from animal origin, in this case the pig pancreas, in this case it is Haram. For this reason this additive is Mushbooh

NAME: Lysozyme
DESCRIPTION: Lysozyme is an enzymatic protein composed of about 130 amino acids (in humans), which is found particularly in egg white, as well as in certain secretions such as tears, saliva and breast milk. It has an antibacterial function. Commercially this substance is obtained from the egg white. Caution in people with egg allergy and its derivatives. It is widely used in cheeses and spreads.

NAME: Polydextrose
GROUP:
bulking agent,
glazing agent,
humectant,
stabilizer,
thickener
DESCRIPTION: This additive is produced from glucose, sorbitol (E420) and citric acid (E330). In the human body, it behaves like a dietary fiber. It is obtained by synthesis from dextrose (glucose). Classified as a soluble fiber with a sweet taste. It is used in sugar-free chocolates, light beverages and low-calorie foods. No side effects have been found. At large doses it can cause flatulence and or diarrhea.

NAME: Polyvinylpyrrolidone
DESCRIPTION: It is obtained as a derivative of vinyl epirrolidone. It allows to join the lightening agents in drinks. It is used in wines and some beers. It is also used as a disintegrant in pharmaceutical tablets. In large doses causes cancer and spontaneous abortions in laboratory animals. This additive is believed that it could remain in our body even years after having consumed it, despite this, it is not mandatory to indicate its use in the labeling of the product.

NAME: Polyvinylpolypyrrolidone (carrier)
DESCRIPTION: It is obtained as a derivative of vinyl epirrolidone. It allows to join the lightening agents in drinks. It is used in wines and some beers. It is also used as a disintegrant in pharmaceutical tablets. Polyvinylpyrrolidone is also inserted into cosmetics (hair fixatives, binders, antistatics, emulsifiers, etc.). In large doses causes cancer and spontaneous abortions in laboratory animals. This additive is believed that it could remain in our body even years after having consumed it, despite this, it is not mandatory to indicate its use in the labeling of the product. Daily intake: Up to 50 mg kg of body weight day.

NAME: Polyvinyl alcohol
DESCRIPTION: Polyvinyl alcohol is a synthetic polymer obtained by alkaline hydrolysis (sodium hydroxide, potassium hydroxide) of polyvinyl acetate. The E1203 is a recent additive (2010), there is still very little information available on the substance consumed as a food additive, however, the data of the pure substance are not really attractive. The finished product contains toxic residues: methanol, methyl acetate, etc. Polyvinyl alcohol is also found in cosmetics and in many pharmaceutical products. Daily intake: Up to 50 mg kg of body weight day.

NAME: Pullulan
DESCRIPTION: Pullulan is a polysaccharide made of starch by the fungus Aureobasidium pullulans. In other words, it is derived from starch extracted from wood, cereals and vegetables fermented by the fungus It is used in capsules, tablets, covers and edible films used in chewing gums, dragees, enamels and pills to freshen the breath. It is also used in oral hygiene products and mouthwashes. No side effects have been found for this additive. Other uses of this additive can be found in pharmaceuticals and cosmetics.

NAME: Dextrin (Dextrins, roasted starch white and yellow) (stabiliser)
DESCRIPTION: E1400 dextrins are a family of polysaccharides, dextrose polymers (glucose, nd.) Prepared by partial degradation with hydrochloric or ortho-phosphoric acid. They may be of natural origin obtained from tapioca starch, rice or potatoes or from synthetic origin derived from transgenic maize starches. They are also used to give greater stability in frozen foods that need to maintain the same texture and appearance when thawed. They are used in sauces, mayonnaises, soups, cheeses, dairy products, cream for cooking, yoghurts, puddings, custards, desserts, sweets, candies, cocoa powder, vegetable preparations, stuffed cakes, soft drinks, juices, juices, meat products and frozen. In large doses can cause hyperactivity and digestive discomfort. E1400 can cause an allergic reaction in some people, it contains traces of allergens such as wheat or corn. For gluten intolerant, check that it is not wheat starch.

NAME: Modified starch ((Acid-treated starch) stabiliser)
DESCRIPTION: They may be of natural origin obtained from tapioca starch, rice or potatoes or from synthetic origin derived from transgenic maize starches. They are also used to give greater stability in frozen foods that need to maintain the same texture and appearance when thawed. They are used in sauces, mayonnaises, soups, cheeses, dairy products, cream for cooking, yoghurts, puddings, custards, desserts, sweets, candies. E1401 starches are frequently present as not or slightly toxic, however, chemical modifications can be dangerous, and transgenic raw materials (corn, wheat, potato). In large doses can cause hyperactivity and digestive discomfort.

In pharmacy, this oil has been used for a long time for its laxative effects, but it is a violent purgative and its use is not formally recommended for this indication It remains present, in small quantities, as an excipient in many pharmaceutical specialties.
