DESCRIPTION: Natural component of many fruits; It is produced commercially from acetic acid. Ethyl acetate is a flavor component as well as a solvent for flavors. It is used in many fruity products. No side effects found

NAME: Triethyl citrate
DESCRIPTION: It is colorless and oily. Obtained as an ester derived from Citric Acid (E330). Triethyl citrate is a synthetic compound manufactured by esterification of citric acid and ethanol. The additive can be produced by genetic engineering. No side effects are known now. It is recommended not to abuse, since there is little information about this additive.

NAME: Ethanol
DESCRIPTION: Ethanol, better known as alcohol, is a basic component of alcoholic beverages such as wine and cider (10 to 13%), beer (0.5 to 7%) and spirits (40 to 50%). . In the European Pharmacopoeia, ethanol refers to absolute ethanol, that is, 100% pure (without water), unlike 95% ethanol or 70% found in the pharmacy. Ethanol can be produced from petrochemical products by hydration of ethylene (industry), among others, or by alcoholic fermentation of yeast or cellulose. Ethanol E1510 may contain traces of highly toxic residues (eg, methanol, benzene) and or carcinogens.

NAME: Glyceryl monoacetate
DESCRIPTION: Additive E1516 is a mixture of esters produced from the esterification of glycerol with acetic acid, that is to say that it is produced commercially from acetic acid and glycerol. Its function is to act on the senses of taste either to reinforce one's own or specific aroma, in order to make it more appetizing or pleasant. There is not much information about this additive, so far no side effects have been found.

NAME: Glyceryl diacetate or diacetin
DESCRIPTION: Glyceryl diacetate is a synthetic additive and is manufactured chemically with glycerol and acetic acid. No known side effects to date, at dietary doses, however, the toxicology of diacetin would not be fully known. Ingestion of pure diacetin can cause migraines, nausea, vomiting, dehydration, diarrhea, thirst, dizziness and confusion.

NAME: Glyceryl triacetate or triacetin
DESCRIPTION: Triacetin triacetate or glyceryl is a triglyceride, glycerol triester (E422) and acetic acid (E260). It is an artificial compound, obtained by esterification of natural glycerin or petrochemical with acetic anhydride. It is used to create specific artificial flavors, smells and aromas. It is also used in the manufacture of perfumes, to manufacture cellulose and in the development of photographic reels (negative). It appears in the list of 599 substances added to cigarettes. It can be obtained from transgenic products such as soybeans. It is recommended to avoid this additive.

NAME: Benzyl alcohol
DESCRIPTION: Benzyl alcohol is naturally produced by many plants and is commonly found in fruits and teas. It is also found in a variety of essential oils. Also known as hydroxytoluene or toluene, the benzyl alcohol can be prepared industrially in many ways, inter alia from toluene or by reaction of bromide with formaldehyde. Benzyl alcohol is of low acute toxicity. It oxidizes rapidly in healthy individuals with benzoic acid, conjugated with glycine in the liver and excreted as hippuric acid. It is toxic to newborns and is associated with the panting syndrome. In large doses causes abdominal pain, diarrhea, drowsiness, nausea and vomiting.

NAME: Propylene glycol
DESCRIPTION: Synthetic artificial industrial compound, produced in various ways, including the use of propylene oxide. This additive is colorless and has a characteristic odor. It is obtained by hydration of Propylene Oxide. It is used in the color of margarines and butters, as food antifreeze and flavoring in the narrowness (alcoholic beverage). It is also used as a tobacco moisturizer, in cosmetics, pharmaceuticals and as a genital intimate lubricant. It is widely used in smoke machines, including electronic cigarettes (vapers). In large doses caused serious damage to the nervous system in laboratory animals. Prohibited in feeding for dogs and cats for causing liver problems. Our body metabolizes it to a large extent as Lactic Acid (E270).
